revision.text: ==Classical Nahuatl== ===Etymology=== '''[[xiuhtototl|xiuhtōtōtl]]''' "Lovely Cotinga" + '''[[-tic]]''' ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nci|/ʃiwtoːtoːtik/}} ===Noun=== {{head|nci|noun|head=xiuhtōtōtic}} # [[Lovely Cotinga]]-colored. #* '''16C:''' [[w:Bernardino de Sahagún|Bernardino de Sahagún]], "[[w:Florentine Codex|Florentine Codex]]", book 11, chapter 2, paragraph 2 #*: Xihujtzilli: macitica, motqujtica texotic: '''xiuhtototic''', ticeoac, teuhxiuhtic, xippopoca, teuxippopoca. #*: (Costa hummingbird: It is entirely, completely light blue like a cotinga, pale like fine turquoise. It is resplendent like turquoise, like fine turquoise.) ===References=== * {{cite-book|author=Sahagún, Bernardino de|year=1981|title=Florentine Codex|others=ed. and trans. by Arthur J. O. Anderson and Charles E. Dibble|edition=2nd ed., rev.|location=Salt Lake City|publisher=University of Utah Press|pages=part XII, p. 24}} [[Category:nci:Colors]]
